name: name
loadingTitle: loading data, please wait a moment

credential.emptyCredentialTips: you can create a new credential
credential.validateName: Credential name cannot be empty. Only English characters, numbers, underscores, and English periods are supported
credential.noCreateCredPermissionTips: You have no permission to [create] credentials in this project. Please apply for permission or try in another project
credential.sshKeyPlaceholder: Please enter the corresponding private key for SSH Key, starting with -----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY----- and ending with -----END RSA PRIVATE KEY-----
credential.passwordDesc: Used for information that needs to be encrypted and saved in the Blue Shield platform, such as certificate password, encrypted fields in scripts, etc.
credential.accessTokenDesc: An access token contains security information for this login session. It's used to link with Gitlab-typed code repo
credential.appIdDesc: Used to set the type of key-value pair for specific key values, such as the user account password to be filled in bugly atom, the api call, etc.
credential.sshKeyDesc: SSH contains public and private keys, which are used to link SVN-typed code repo. For SSH configuration instructions, please refer to Blue Shield Documentation Center.
credential.sshKeyTokenDesc: Used for linking Git-typed code repo through ssh
credential.passwordTokenDesc: Used for linking Git-typed code repo through http

cert.validateName: Certificate name cannot be empty. Only English characters, numbers, underscores, and English periods are supported
cert.emptyCertTips: You can create a new iOS or Android certificate
cert.successfullyEditedCert: you've successfully made edits to this certificate
cert.successfullyCreatedCert: you've successfully created a new certificate
cert.filePlaceholer: please upload files that end with .jks or .keystore
cert.passwordPlaceholer: please select the credential that's associated with JKS certificate password
cert.aliasPlaceHolder: Certificate alias cannot be empty. Only English characters, numbers, underscores, and English periods are supported
cert.aliasPasswordPlaceholer: please select the credential that's associated with alias password
cert.remarkFileRule: please upload description files that end with .mobileprovision
cert.p12FileRule: please enter p12 files that end with .p12
cert.p12RelativeCred: please select the credential that's associated with P12 certificate password
